channel.title: Qubes virtualization question
channel.description: Hey everyone, so I am trying to install qubes on my computer for the first time and I have been through documentation. When I try to install I get the error right after selecting language about virtualization. I have intel virtualization enabled in bios and still getting that error. What should I do?

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
5sharpknives:

Don’t blame me if you brick your machine but some instructions.

Y’all need to chill and stop pointing fingers… or giving them.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
TNT_BOM_BOM:

Yes because your PC is trash.

Not necessarily. Qubes/Xen needs serious hardware resource commitment for smooth performance. There are other Whonix flavors that can work for your situation liek VBox if you need a beginner friendly platform or KVM if you have Linux installed and want better performance and security.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
Whoniepro:

So thats it? Cant use the OS and tahts all?

Yes because your PC is trash.

But if you want to debug or go for deep discussion please discuss this with Qubes not here as @Patrick referred you.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: Whoniepro
item.description:
I know but instructions are saying if you get that error to enable VT in bios, which I did and still getting this error.

So thats it? Cant use the OS and tahts all?

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
It doesn’t say anything is disabled in the bios.

It’s saying your hardware is not supported.

Qubes doesn’t work on all hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: Whoniepro
item.description:
Yes but I have it enabled in bios and still getting that error.

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Qubes installation issues aren’t Qubes-Whonix issues. As per:

What to post in this Qubes-Whonix forum and what not. Qubes-Whonix
As a rule of thumb: Everything that happens “inside” the virtual machines is Qubes-Whonix and belongs into this sub forum. Everything that happens “outside” the virtual machine is Qubes and the Qubes help should be consulted. Some examples: EFI -> Qubes support Errors by by Qubes VM Manager (QVMM) -> Qubes support libvirtError -> Qubes support Issues that also apply to Debian based VMs. -> Qubes support error: Failed to save domain whonix-ws-dvm to /var/lib/qubes/appvms/whonix-ws-dvm/…

Please use Qubes support:

Qubes OS

Help, Support, and Mailing Lists

Help, Support, and Mailing Lists Help and support for Qubes OS is available from the documentation and the mailing lists, which are explained below. The Qubes OS Project does not offer paid support services. If you’re looking for known issues or...

Read full topic

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
It tells you exactly what’s wrong. Your hardware isn’t supported.

Read full topic

Unsupported hardware detected

item.title: Qubes virtualization question
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
You need to be more descriptive than “there is an error”. Say exactly what the error is.

Read full topic
